meanings.definition: Lying above or upon something else.
meanings.sent1: The superjacent book rested on top of the table.
meanings.sent2: The map was superjacent to the stack of papers on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The superjacent cat decided to nap on the warm laptop.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a superjacent melody floating above the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The superjacent clouds cast shadows on the ground below.

meanings.definition: Situated on or above something else.
meanings.sent1: The superjacent shelf held all the books in the library.
meanings.sent2: The painting was superjacent to the window in the room.
meanings.sent3: The superjacent flower pot seemed to be watching over the garden.
meanings.sent4: His words hung in the air like a superjacent mist.
meanings.sent5: The superjacent banner fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The superjacent blanket kept her warm during the night.
meanings.sent2: The dust settled on the superjacent surface of the table.
meanings.sent3: The superjacent snow made the landscape look like a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a superjacent mask hiding his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The superjacent leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.
